TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit I2cBusExtensions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains extension methods that operate on the I2c bus

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Generic.List<int> PerformBusScan (this System.Device.I2c.I2cBus bus, int lowest = 3, int highest = 119);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<int32> PerformBusScan(class System.Device.I2c.I2cBus bus, int32 lowest, int32 highest) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function PerformBusScan (bus As I2cBus, Optional lowest As Integer = 3, Optional highest As Integer = 119) As List(Of Integer)
static member PerformBusScan : System.Device.I2c.I2cBus * int * int -> System.Collections.Generic.List<int>

Docs.param: The lowest address to scan. Default 0x03
The highest address to scan. Default 0x77
Docs.summary: Performs a scan on the I2C bus, returning the addresses for all connected devices.
Docs.returns: A list of bus addresses that are in use, an empty list if no device was found
Docs.remarks: This method should never throw an exception. Bus scanning may interfere with normal device operation, so this should not be done while devices are being used.

MemberSignature.Value: public static (System.Collections.Generic.List<int> FoundDevices, int LowestAddress, int HighestAddress) PerformBusScan (this System.Device.I2c.I2cBus bus, IProgress<float>? progress, int lowestAddress = 3, int highestAddress = 119);

static member PerformBusScan : System.Device.I2c.I2cBus * IProgress<single> * int * int -> ValueTuple<System.Collections.Generic.List<int>, int, int>

Docs.param: Progress feedback provider. Receives scan progress in percent
The lowest address to scan. Default 0x03
The highest address to scan. Default 0x77
Docs.summary: Performs a scan on the I2C bus, returning the addresses for all connected devices.
Docs.returns: A list of bus addresses that are in use, an empty list if no device was found
Docs.remarks: This method should never throw an exception. Bus scanning may interfere with normal device operation, so this should not be done while devices are being used.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToUserReadableTable (this (System.Collections.Generic.List<int> FoundDevices, int LowestAddress, int HighestAddress) data);
.method public static hidebysig string ToUserReadableTable(valuetype System.ValueTuple`3<class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<int32>, int32, int32> data) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function ToUserReadableTable (data As ValueTuple(Of List(Of Integer), Integer, Integer)) As String
static member ToUserReadableTable : ValueTuple<System.Collections.Generic.List<int>, int, int> -> string

Docs.param: The result of a bus scan
Docs.summary: Converts the output of into a user-readable table, corresponding to the output of the standard linux command i2cdetect.
Docs.returns: A table in form of a multiline string for the first 127 possible devices. An empty field represents an address that was not tested, a -- means no device found and a number means there was a device at that address
